contextId.information: The Jews believed that God spoke his law to Moses through angels. This can be stated in active form. AT: "For if the message that God spoke through the angels" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For if the message that was spoken through the angels

contextId.information: This is refers to when Abraham and his men went and defeated the armies of four kings in order to rescue his nephew, Lot, and his family. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings

contextId.information: You can make explicit what "Therefore" implies. AT: "Because Christ is our high priest who lives forever," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses did not construct the tabernacle himself. He ordered the people to construct it. AT: "was about to command the people to construct the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: was about to construct the tabernacle

contextId.information: This refers to when God proved to the people of Israel that he had chosen Aaron as his priest by making Aaron's rod bud. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This is the second part of the Holy Spirit's testimony (See: [[:en:bible:notes:heb:10:15|10:15-16]]). You can make this explicit in the translation. AT: "Then next he said, 'No more will I remember their sins and iniquities.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: No more will I remember their sins and iniquities

contextId.information: You can make explicit that the people met to worship. AT: "Let us not stop coming together to worship" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Let us not stop meeting together

contextId.information: No one is able to give a new sacrifice because Christ's sacrifice is the only one that works. AT: "no one can offer a sacrifice for which God will forgive our sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: a sacrifice for sins no longer exists

contextId.information: Of God's judgment, that is, that God will judge. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that this means "of at least two or three witness." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This refers to God's command to the Israelites to kill a lamb and spread its blood on every doorpost of every house where Israelites lived. This would prevent the destroyer from harming their firstborn sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The implicit information can be stated explicitly. AT: "For you have not come, as the people of Israel came, to a mountain that can be touched" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: For you have not come to a mountain that can be touched

contextId.information: The implicit information can be stated explicitly. AT: "if the people of Israel did not escape judgment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
